intro: Zaluzianskia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican false nettle, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Zaluzianskia mexicana is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
